newsitem.title: USA: Chase Brass sees acquisition adding to EPS.
newsitem.headline: Chase Brass sees acquisition adding to EPS.

text.p: Chase Brass Industries Inc said Wednesday it expected its acquisition of the UNR-Leavitt Division of UNR Industries Inc to immediately add $0.15 to $0.25 per share to its 1997 fiscal year earnings.
"The acquisition ... provides increased profit opportunities through better utilization of existing manufacturing facilities and resulting operating efficiencies," it said.

On August 30, Chase Brass said it had completed its acquisition of the division for $95 million, a price that is subject to post-closing adjustments estimated to result in a reduction of $2.5 million.
It said it would rename Leavitt as Leavitt Tube Company Inc, which will operate as a wholly-owned subsidiary.
Leavitt makes structural and mechanical steel tubing that is used in farm equipment, among other things.
Chase Brass makes brass rods at a plant in Montpelier, Ohio.
